Detailed Description

Spiking neuron.

This class abstract the behaviour of a neuron in a spiking neural network. It includes network characteristics as index in the network or input and output connections and spiking characteristics as the neural model, the current state, the last updated time, or the spike prediction.

Author:
Jesus Garrido

Richard Carrillo

Date:
August 2008

Definition at line 42 of file Neuron.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Neuron::Neuron (  ) 

Default constructor without parameters.

It generates a new default neuron object without input connections, output connections or neuron model. The neuron will be initialized with the default values.

Definition at line 10 of file Neuron.cpp.

Neuron::Neuron ( int  NewIndex,
NeuronType *  Type,
bool  Monitored,
bool  IsOutput 
)

Neuron constructor with parameters.

It generates a new neuron with neuron model Type and neuron index NewIndex. Moreover, it initializes the neuron variables with the model initial values.

Parameters:
NewIndex The neuron index into the network order.
Type The neuron type. It can't be null.
Monitored If true, the neuron activity will be registered.
IsOutput If true, the neuron activity will be send to output driver
See also:
InitNeuron()

void Neuron::SynapsisEffect ( Interconnection *  inter  )  [private]

It calculates the effect of an input spike in the neuron.

It calculates the effect of an input spike belong the interconnection inter. It updates the neuron membrane potential according the connection synaptic weight.

Parameters:
inter Input connection where the spike fire.
Precondition:
inter must be an input connection to the current neuron.

Referenced by ProcessInputSynapticActivity().

double Neuron::FiringPrediction (  )  [private]

It calculates the spike firing time.

It calculates the time to the next spike fire with the current neural state. It queries the firing prediction table.

Returns:
The time to the next fire. -1.0 if spike won't be fired with the current state.

double Neuron::FiringEndPrediction (  )  [private]

It calculates the time when the next spike will finish.

It calculates the time to the next spike finish with the current neural state. It queries the firing end prediction table.

Returns:
The time to the next fire ends.

NeuronType *  Type,
bool  Monitored,
bool  IsOutput 
)

It initializes the neuron values.

Parameters:

Type The neuron type. It can't be null.
Monitored If true, the neuron activity will be registered.

void Neuron::InitNeuronPrediction ( EventQueue *  eventQueue  ) 

It generates the initial neuron activity.

It generates the initial events in the neuron. It gets the time when the first spike will be fired (without external activity) and inserts a new event in SpikeQueue.

Parameters:
eventQueue The event queue where the event will be inserted.

void Neuron::GenerateAutoActivity ( EventQueue *  eventQueue  ) 

It generates the next spike in the neuron without input activity.

It checks if the neuron will fire a new spike without input activity and inserts its in the spike queue.

Note:
It's only necessary when the neuron can fire periodically without input activity.
Parameters:
eventQueue The event queue where the event will be inserted.

Parameters:
InputSpike Input spike who arrives the current object.
Precondition:

Note:

void Neuron::GenerateOutputActivity ( Spike *  InputSpike,
EventQueue *  eventQueue 
)

It generates the first output spike.

It produces the first output spike in the first output connection of the current neuron. This spike will be propagated.

Parameters:
InputSpike Current spike which generates the activity.
eventQueue The event queue where the event will be inserted.
Note:
This function will be called when we process a spike with target lower than 0.

void Neuron::PropagateOutputSpike ( PropagatedSpike *  LastSpike,
EventQueue *  eventQueue 
)

It propagates an output spike.

It produces the next output spike in the next output connection.

Parameters:
LastSpike The last processed spike.
Precondition:
LastSpike.GetSource() must be equal to this.
Parameters:
eventQueue The event queue where the event will be inserted.
Note:
This function will be called when we process a spike with target greater or equal than 0.

void Neuron::GenerateInputActivity ( EventQueue *  eventQueue  ) 

It checks if a new spike will be fired.

It updates the neuron next spike time and inserts the spike in the event queue. Moreover, it checks if the neuron generates autoactivity.

Parameters:
eventQueue The event queue where the event will be inserted.
Note:
This function will be called after we process a propagated spike.
